title: Master: two tikv don't report region heartbeat after inject fault to pd leader
body:

comments_data.body:
```
[2022/06/27 04:59:09.479 +00:00] [ERROR] [client.rs:631] ["failed to send heartbeat"] [err_code=KV:PD:gRPC] [err="Grpc(RpcFinished(Some(RpcStatus { code: 14-UNAVAILABLE, message: \"not leader\", details: [] })))"]
[2022/06/27 04:59:09.800 +00:00] [ERROR] [util.rs:447] ["request failed, retry"] [err_code=KV:PD:gRPC] [err="Grpc(RpcFailure(RpcStatus { code: 14-UNAVAILABLE, message: \"not leader\", details: [] }))"]
```

Found some TiKVs were keeping reconnecting the PD who is not leader.
It could be introduced by https://github.com/tikv/tikv/pull/12629. @Connor1996 Do you have any idea to fix this issue?

Turns out it was caused by PD RegionHeartbeat RPC returns an "OK" response, then the stream exited on TiKV side without any retrying mechanism.
![yqiirc4368](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20279863/177092800-6e470cc1-eee1-4606-b472-600772b39fff.jpg)
![origin_img_v2_daf0f176-a759-4003-b050-7de3dcefbb1g](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20279863/177092621-2b81a53a-b0eb-458a-a116-12414966b176.jpg)

Think we need to fix this issue on PD.

In the faulted cluster, I use tcpdump to capture the net direction of the faulted tikvï¼š
faulted tikv ->  old pd: none
faulted tikv -> new pd: normal 

so I think the potential problem is not the response of  the RegionHeartbeat RPC.

> Turns out it was caused by PD RegionHeartbeat RPC returns an "OK" response, then the stream exited on TiKV side without any retrying mechanism. ![yqiirc4368](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20279863/177092800-6e470cc1-eee1-4606-b472-600772b39fff.jpg) ![origin_img_v2_daf0f176-a759-4003-b050-7de3dcefbb1g](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20279863/177092621-2b81a53a-b0eb-458a-a116-12414966b176.jpg)
> 
> Think we need to fix this issue on PD.

I think the potential problem is this code:
https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/dc7c48d1731e079ae0949694f88858554982136e/components/pd_client/src/client.rs#L644-L647.

The unkown error will not trigger the event that will reconnect pd  client even if the pd respinse is  the grpc errors.
